intro: Sclerostemma agreste, commonly known as the wild nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the evening. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinct, somewhat toxic appearance. Sclerostemma agreste is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
